section.title: Conventions used in this manual
section.para: GMP Forth word usage is usually illustrated with examples in an interactive terminal session.

callout.para: User input is indicated like this, which represents characters that you would type.
↩ represents the key that indicates input should be accepted, often via a word like . On many keyboards this key is labeled Enter or Return, and is often just called the Return key.
Terminal output is indicated like this, which represents characters that GMP Forth displays with words like or .
